etymology.description: Originally a vertical stroke later crossed by 一; possibly a pictogram of a needle, rebus-borrowed for the word ‘ten’.
etymology.interpretation: Early forms may have depicted a needle, and that form’s sound was repurposed to write the word for “ten.” The cross shape developed when a horizontal stroke was added to the original vertical line.

examples.chinese: 我有十个苹果(我有十個蘋果)。
现在是十点(現在是十點)。
我们十个人一起去(我們十個人一起去)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒmen shí ge rén yìqǐ qù.
examples.english: Ten of us are going together.
